title: Sara Leonardi and Glenn McGrath step out with their baby girl Madison
title_page: Sara Leonardi and Glenn McGrath step out with their baby girl Madison | Daily Mail Online
text:
They welcomed their new baby Madison into the world just last September after thinking they'd never be able to conceive.
And as Sara Leonardi and her husband Glenn McGrath headed out to lunch with their infant on Friday, the three well and truly looked like the perfect family in matching ensembles.
Whether it was deliberate or not that the legendary cricketer, 45, and his wife, 34, donned co-ordinated blue linen shirts, they undoubtedly looked picture perfect on their lunch outing in Sydney.

Families who dress together stay together! Sara Leonardi and Glenn McGrath stepped out for lunch on Friday in Sydney with their baby girl Madison, wearing matching blue linen shirts
The interior designer opted for a baby blue collared shirt, wrapping a white and blue light-weight scarf around her neck, adding cement-coloured chinos and slip-on shoes for comfort.
The mother-of-one shielded her eyes from the glare with a pair of cats-eye sunglasses and tied her hair in a half-up pony tail.
Her husband meanwhile, chose an identical hue for his shirt, wearing it un-tucked with a pair of navy shorts and brown suede sneakers.
Family outing: The trio headed out for lunch in Cronulla, braving the stormy weather
Baby blue: The interior designer opted for a baby blue collared shirt, wrapping a white and blue light-weight scarf around her neck, adding cement-coloured chinos and slip-on shoes for comfort
Chic: The mother-of-one shielded her eyes from the glare with a pair of cats-eye sunglasses
Even the blanket covering the stroller on the stormy day in the beach-side suburb of Cronulla, was baby blue.
As the doting parents lifted their tiny tot into the car, Madison could be seen napping soundly.
This is the couple's first child together, with their trouble conceiving well documented, enduring two rounds of IVF after the fast bowler had his vasectomy reversed.
The overjoyed pair announced their pregnancy to the monthly title in May, with Glenn telling The Australian Women's Weekly: 'We're adding to our family and we couldn't be more delighted.
Napping soundly: Madison could be seen napping soundly as her mother placed her into the car

'Sara and I are very happy together and the kids are two really happy, normal children and I think, at the end of the day, thatâ€™s really the true measure of what Sara and I have built together these last five years of marriage.'
The couple met during the 2009 Indian Premier League, a year after Glenn lost Jane to breast cancer in 2008, and got together shortly afterwards.
Glenn has two other children, Holly, 12, and James, 15, with his late wife Jane.
